intro: Oldenlandia elegans, commonly known as the "silverleaf" or "tropical mosquito plant," is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its use in traditional medicine.
